isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - GENERAL INFORMATION - 1994 - CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS - ELECTRICAL CIRCUITS

svcprocinfo.para:
The individual circuits are identified by circuit number, wire gauge, and abbreviated wire colors. Complete circuit diagram instructions are shown in
CIRCUIT DIAGRAM INSTRUCTIONS
of this chapter.

svcsubproc.title: VREF Circuits
svcsubproc.para: Many of the circuits in the electronic engine control system carry low voltage and low current signals referred to as VREF. This voltage is approximately 5 volts. With Cummins engines these circuits will have a (5V) suffix included in the circuit number. For example 97AF(5V) would be a VREF circuit.

With Caterpillar and Detroit Diesel engines the circuits are not always identified with the five volt (5V) addition to the circuit number. Refer to the Operation Description in each chapter for a discussion on how each circuit operates. Caterpillar, Cummins and Detroit Diesel manuals contain complete information on their respective systems.

svcsubproc.title: Data Link Circuits
